intro: Conanthus stenophyllus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf conanthus, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes Mountains in South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers and herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its narrow, lance-shaped leaves are adapted to minimize water loss in its harsh habitat. Conanthus stenophyllus is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens with specific growing conditions.
